issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

fields.summary: Walrus: Delete object fails with 404 if a DeleteMarker is present

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
a) create bucket
b) enable bucket versioning
c) run the following sequence on an object,
PUT -> DELETE -> PUT -> DELETE
d) now when another DELETE request is sent to the same object in this bucket, it throws the following exception,
{noformat}

{noformat}

AWS behavior in such situation:
It creates a new DeleteMarker on each DELETE request on a deleted object.
fields.summary: S3 Compatibility: DELETE object request from version enabled bucket throws exception

comments.body: [~shaon], Can you please retry this against the osg? I'm taking this bug off of the 4.0 list for now as it is a compatibility issue. We should get to this in a point release.
This bug is only in 3.4.1 and 3.4.2, cannot reproduce in 4.0.0
